settings.html_content:
How to choose a right base among all these different options out there? Our Base Guide here is to help you choose easily.
Here we will explain the differences among different base patterns, pros and cos, so to help you find the one that will work for you considering the lifestyle, living environment and hairstyle that you want to have.

  • Full Lace Base
  • Lace/Skin Hybrid Base
  • Skin Base
  • Mono Base
  • Silk Base
  • Hair Patches
  • Full Cap Wig

Full Lace Bases

Lace is soft, lightweight, delicate and totally breathable.For a lace base, we usually use single knots in the front hairline and double knots elsewhere,
which helps to create a natural hairline. If you exercise often, a lace base is your best choice as it is breathable.
Typically, a lace base hair system can last 4-6 months with the correct care and maintenance.

Helios

  • Swiss Lace Base
  • More Soft and transparent

Thor

  • French Lace Base
  • A bit more stronger than Swiss Lace
  • Breathable. Good for Active lifestyle and hot weather

Lace/Skin Hybrid Bases

Hybrid base is comparatively more durable than full lace bases given the same condition.

Atlas

  • Lace Front + Lace Center + 1’’ PU on sides and back
  • Lace hairline

Crius

  • Lace in center with 1.5’’ PU in perimeter
  • Skin hairline
  • Breathable and durable. Easy application, removal & cleaning

Simois

  • Lace front + Lace Center + PU around
  • Lace hairline

Ares

  • Lace front + Lace top + 2.5’’ skin on side/back
  • Lace hairline
  • Breathable and durable. Easy application, removal & cleaning

Skin Bases

A skin base, as the name suggests, it looks and feels just like your own skin.
Skin bases which measure thinner than 0.06mm offers you a super natural and undetectable hairline that you can expose the hairline and have a slicked-back hairstyle.

Eros

  • 0.02-0.03mm C-through Bio Skin
  • Thinnest skin
  • Most Natural looking hairline
  • Delicate and only lasts 1-2 months
  • For light density hair no more than 90%

Louis

  • 0.04-0.06mm C-through Bio Skin
  • Second thinnest skin
  • Natural looking hairline
  • Not so delicate and can last around 3 months
  • For Medium light density hair around 95-100%

Coeus

  • 0.08mm thin skin
  • Durable and a bit thick
  • For thick hairstyle
  • For medium light density around 110-120%

Achilles

  • 0.10-0.12mm skin
  • Very Durable and thick
  • For thick hairstyle
  • For Medium or high density of 130% or more

Mono Bases

A mono base is thicker and stronger than lace and skin and will certainly last longer.
Monofilament base hair systems can last more than 6 months. They can carry medium thick hair like 120% or 130% density.
This is suitable for those who are looking for pretty thick and lush hair and also want to save some money considering the long-time investment.

Adrien

  • Lace Front + Mono Top + NPU around the base

Versalite

  • Lace Front + Mono Top + NPU around the base
  • Breathable and very durable. Last 6-9 months.
  • Natural looking hairline, super durable, easy to work with
  • Good base choice for long and thick hair

Apollo

  • Mono Top + NPU around the base with Scallop hairline

Brad

  • Mono Top + NPU around the base + Under-vented hairline
  • Super Durable, good base choice for long and thick hair

Silk Base

A silk top base creates the most natural and scalp looking hairline. Using a tri-layer system, when the hair is knotted,
the knots are made below the silk concealed between the layers, the hair is then injected through the silk material making the knots 100% invisible,
giving the illusion that the hair is growing out of your scalp.

Prometheus

  • Silk base (aka French Drawn) + Lace front + 1’’ Skin on sides and back

Poseidon

  • Silk base (aka French Drawn) + 1’’ Skin in perimeter
  • Can Last more than 1 year
  • Natural looking hairline, super durable, easy to work with
  • Good base choice for long and thick hair

Hair patches

All these hair patches can be made with skin base or full lace base

  • Side/back hair patch

  • Temple hair patch

  • Heavy receding hairline patch

  • Crown hair patch

  • Hairline Patch

Full cap wig

In contrast to normal hair systems that cover only the top of the scalp, a full cap wig covers the whole head, including top,
sides, back, temples, sideburns, and all the areas where there is supposed to be hair.

Bradley

  • Lace Front and top + skin around the base
  • Lace hairline
  • 100% Hand-tied
  • A bit More expensive

Azriel

  • Lace top + skin around the base
  • Skin hairline
  • 100% Hand-tied
  • A bit More expensive

Jayden

  • Lace Front + Mono Top + Weft back + Skin around
  • Lace hairline
  • Half hand-tied, half machine weft
  • More economic

How to measure the size for a full cap wig that you need


Here at LaVivid, we can literally make any kind of hair system base that you have in mind. If you cannot find the one you want from above options, please feel free to contact us through support@lavividhair.com or give us a call at 833-879-0279 and our customer service experts will assist you choose the most suitable base for your lifestyle, wearing routine, budgets, etc.
